oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-10-24 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 24, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer), guest performers Flatt & Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1046th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Archie Campbell; Ferlin Husky; Flatt & Scruggs; Foggy Mountain Boys; Grandpa Jones; Porter Wagoner
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Archie Campbell) -- The Proof Is In The Puffing (Ferlin Husky) (recording) -- Grant Turner introduces Flatt & Scruggs -- Someone You Have Forgotten (Flatt & Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys) -- Grant Turner introduces Grandpa Jones -- When The Jones' Get Together (Grandpa Jones) -- Grant Turner introduces Porter Wagoner -- Your Kind Of People (Porter Wagoner) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Porter Wagoner) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Husky, Ferlin; Wagoner, Porter; Flatt, Lester; Scruggs, Earl; Graves, Josh; Sechler, Curly, 1919-; Warren, Paul; Tullock, Jake
